meanings.definition: Baseball players positioned in the infield.
meanings.sent1: The infielders caught the ball swiftly.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the infielders covered their positions well.
meanings.sent3: The infielders joked about having to dive for ground balls.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of green, the infielders stood out like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The coach praised the infielders for their quick reflexes and teamwork.

meanings.definition: The group of players on a baseball team who play in the infield.
meanings.sent1: All the infielders gathered for a strategy meeting.
meanings.sent2: The infielders practiced fielding grounders tirelessly.
meanings.sent3: The infielders celebrated a double play with high-fives.
meanings.sent4: The infielders were the backbone of the team, holding the defense together.
meanings.sent5: The fans cheered loudly for the infielders' outstanding performance.
